word_mean: arterial blood动脉血(用作下角标)
activity (thermodynamic activity of a chemical species)〔化学物质热力〕效能
〔前缀〕缺乏，缺少，无：在元音或h前，则用an

sentence.Network_en: Liver and kidney are particularly rich in vitamin A.
sentence.Network_cn: 肝脏和肾脏富含维生素A。

sentence.Network_en: Details are available from the Hon. Sec. A.R. Bushby.
sentence.Network_cn: 详情可咨询名誉秘书A.R.布什比。

sentence.Network_en: I was assigned to Troop A of the 10th Cavalry.
sentence.Network_cn: 我被派往第10骑兵队的A连。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : weak form of Old English ān 'one'

encyclopedia.content: a，拉丁文、英文等语言中字母的第一个，在英文中也是一个不定冠词。这个字母在很多领域均有应用，代表的含义各不相同，比如物理中表示电流单位，遗传学中表示腺嘌呤，游戏中表示攻击，网络语言中表示诈骗等等。

entry.tran: （指初次提及或非特指的人或物）一（个）
entry.def: You use a or an when you are referring to someone or something for the first time or when people may not know which particular person or thing you are talking about.

example.ex: A waiter entered with a tray...
example.tran: 侍者端着托盘进来了。

example.ex: He started eating an apple...
example.tran: 他开始吃苹果。

entry.tran: （一类人或事物中非特指的）任何一（个）
entry.def: You use a or an when you are referring to any person or thing of a particular type and do not want to be specific.

example.ex: ...expensive make-up that we saw being advertised by a beautiful model...
example.tran: 我们所见的由一位漂亮模特代言的昂贵化妆品

example.ex: I suggest you leave it to an expert...
example.tran: 我建议你把它留给专家来解决。

entry.tran: （用于前加形容词或后加修饰语的不可数名词之前）一（种）
entry.def: You use a or an in front of an uncount noun when that noun follows an adjective, or when the noun is followed by words that describe it more fully.

example.ex: There was a terrible sadness in her eyes...
example.tran: 她眼神中流露出深深的悲伤。

example.ex: He did have a real knowledge of the country...
example.tran: 他对该国的确知之甚多。

entry.def: You use a or an in front of a mass noun when you want to refer to a single type or make of something.

example.ex: Bollinger 'RD' is a rare, highly prized wine.
example.tran: 博林格RD香槟是一种名贵的备受推崇的葡萄酒。

entry.tran: （用于表示数量的词组中）许多/少许/一点
entry.def: You use a in quantifiers such as a lot ,a little, and a bit.

example.ex: I spend a lot on expensive jewelry and clothing...
example.tran: 我花很多钱购买昂贵的首饰和衣服。

example.ex: I've come looking for a bit of advice.
example.tran: 我特来讨教。

entry.tran: （一类人或事物中典型的）一（个）
entry.def: You use a or an to refer to someone or something as a typical member of a group, class, or type.

example.ex: Some parents believe a boy must learn to stand up and fight like a man.
example.tran: 有些父母认为男孩子必须学会像男子汉一样顶天立地，勇于抗争。

example.ex: ...the operation a patient has had.
example.tran: 病人做过的手术

entry.tran: （用于日子、月份或节日的名称之前以表示特例）一个
entry.def: You use a or an in front of the names of days, months, or festivals when you are referring to one particular instance of that day, month, or festival.

example.ex: The interview took place on a Friday afternoon...
example.tran: 采访是在一个星期五的下午进行的。

example.ex: It was a Christmas when shoppers passed by expensive silks in favor of more practical gifts.
example.tran: 这是一个购物者不理会昂贵的丝绸衣服而热衷于更实用礼物的圣诞节。

entry.def: You use a or an when you are saying what someone is or what job they have.

example.ex: I explained that I was an artist...
example.tran: 我解释说自己是个艺术家。

example.ex: He was now a teacher and a respectable member of the community.
example.tran: 他现在是一位教师，并且是社区内受人尊敬的一员。

entry.tran: （用于不为说话人所知的首次提到的人名前）某一（个）
entry.def: You use a or an in front of the names of people as a way of indicating that you do not know them or anything about them and you are saying their name for the first time.

example.ex: The full address on a stick-on label was that of a Mrs P. R. Slater of Peterborough...
example.tran: 不干胶标签上的完整地址写的是彼得伯勒的一位P. R. 斯莱特太太。

example.ex: A Dr Matthew Owens was reported missing while on an expedition to north-eastern Turkey.
example.tran: 据报道，一位叫马修·欧文斯的博士在前往土耳其东北部考察的途中失踪了。

entry.tran: （用于人名前，表示与该人有相同特性或品质）类似…的一个（或一位）
entry.def: You use a or an in front of the names of people when you want to refer to someone else who has the same qualities or character as the person named.

example.ex: When I listen to her play I can hear a new Nigel Kennedy.
example.tran: 从她的演奏中我听出了新一代的奈杰尔·肯尼迪。

entry.tran: （用于姓氏前，表示某人属于某姓氏家族）一位姓…的人
entry.def: You use a or an in front of a surname when you want to refer to someone who belongs to the family with that surname.

example.ex: As far as I can recall, Patti was a Smith.
example.tran: 我记得帕蒂是姓史密斯的。

entry.tran: （用于艺术家名字前）一幅…的画，一件…的雕塑作品
entry.def: You use a or an in front of the names of artists to refer to one individual painting or sculpture created by them.

example.ex: Most people have very little difficulty in seeing why a Van Gogh is a work of genius.
example.tran: 多数人不难理解为什么凡·高的作品是天才之作。

entry.tran: （代替数字one使用，尤用于hundred，hour和metre等表示度量的单词之前以及half, quarter和third等分数之前）
entry.def: You use a or an instead of the number 'one', especially with words of measurement such as 'hundred', 'hour', and 'metre', and with fractions such as 'half', 'quarter', and 'third'.

example.ex: ...more than a thousand acres of land.
example.tran: 1,000多英亩地

example.ex: ...a quarter of an hour...
example.tran: 一刻钟

entry.tran: （用于表示比率的短语中）每一
entry.def: You use a or an in expressions such as eight hours a day to express a rate or ratio.

example.ex: Prices start at £13.95 a metre for printed cotton...
example.tran: 印花棉布以每米13.95英镑的价格起售。

example.ex: The helicopter can zip along at about 150 kilometres an hour.
example.tran: 该直升机能以每小时150公里左右的速度疾进。

means.word_mean: 1. the blood group whose red cells carry the A antigen
2. a metric unit of length equal to one ten billionth of a meter (or 0.0001 micron); used to specify wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation
3. any of several fat-soluble vitamins essential for normal vision; prevents night blindness or inflammation or dryness of the eyes
4. one of the four nucleotides used in building DNA; all four nucleotides have a common phosphate group and a sugar (ribose)
5. (biochemistry) purine base found in DNA and RNA; pairs with thymine in DNA and with uracil in RNA
6. the basic unit of electric current adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites;

sentences.sentence: "a typical household circuit carries 15 to 50 amps"

means.word_mean: 7. the 1st letter of the Roman alphabet

example.en: You have to hang a louie at the "stop" sign.
example.zh: 你必须在那"停"字标牌那儿向左转。

list.explanation: 受制于人，处于不利地位，一筹莫展

example.en: I knew enough about him that I had him over a barrel.
example.zh: 我对他的底细一清二铯，所以我能把他完全控制在手中。

list.explanation: 毫无成功或获胜的希塑

example.en: l know they are on a hiding to nothing.
example.zh: 我知道他们丝毫没有获胜的希望。

list.explanation: 非常喜欢某人，狂热地爱上某人

example.en: She has a crush on the new gym mistress.
example.zh: 她非常喜欢新来的女体育老师。

list.explanation: 挑起事端，引起骚动，大吵大闹，大声抱怨

example.en: I don't want his lawyer to kick up a fuss about this.
example.zh: 我不想让他的律帅对此大动干戈。

example.en: Take a look-see at this one and see if you like it.
example.zh: 你瞧一瞧这个，看看喜不喜欢。

example.en: I took a long look-see through my binoculars.
example.zh: 我用望远镜远远地看了一下。

example.en: Hey, man ! Come in and cop a squat.
example.zh: 嗨，老兄!进来坐坐。

example.en: Did you hear that Pamela Wall swaltowed a watermeton seed?
example.zh: 你听说了吗，帕梅拉·沃尔有喜了？

list.explanation: 急速行进，迅速行动，赶紧，加快速度

example.en: Get a hump on with that assignment,OK?
example.zh: 赶快完成那个任务，行吗？

list.explanation: 最髙一级的人(尤指极富性感的年轻女子)，极好的事物

example.en: She's definitely a ten.
example.zh: 她当然是一位绝色佳人。

example.en: On a scale of one to ten,the pizza's a ten.
example.zh: 按等级来说，这比萨饼是最高一级的。

list.explanation: 非常难应付的、不好对付的人(或事)

example.en: What a bitch of a day!
example.zh: 多么难熬的一天!

example.en: This is a bitch of a job.
example.zh: 这是件很不好办的事。

example.en: He is really a bitch of a boss.
example.zh: 他真是个难侍候的老板。

example.en: That bankroll would choke a horse.
example.zh: 那笔钱大概是笔大数目吧。

example.en: It was I who opened a can of beans.
example.zh: 是我惹的祸。

example.en: She was one of those people who like opening a can of beans.
example.zh: 她就是那种喜欢惹祸的人。

example.en: The trucker grabbed a handful of air suddenly on the cross street.
example.zh: 卡车司机突然在十字路u口来了个急刹车。

list.explanation: 以十分艳丽或令人振奋的方式，很神气地，非常成功地

example.en: The party started off with a bang.
example.zh: 晚会是以十分振奋人心的方式开幕的。

example.en: The thing succeeded with a bang.
example.zh: 事情大获成功。

list.explanation: (驾驶高速汽车用语)急刹车，突然减速

example.en: He tried to leave a strip the car, but it's in vain because the brakes would not hold.
example.zh: 他想急刹车，可是却没刹住车,刹车失灵了。

list.explanation: 呼唤(某人)，向(某人)打招呼或行礼

example.en: An old friend gave me a blow from the other side of the street.
example.zh: 一位老朋友在街道对面朝我打招呼。

example.en: He can win in a walk in medicine.
example.zh: 他能在医学方面轻而易举地获得成功。

example.en: I'm really interested in her in a big way.
example.zh: 我的确对她非常感兴趣。

example.en: He carried a case on $1,000 bail.
example.zh: 他交保1,000美元后在外候审。

list.explanation: 非常热烈地，十分热情地

example.en: They greeted the notion with a purple passion.
example.zh: 他们热情万分地赞赏这一想法。

example.en: You still tie a bag on now and again.
example.zh: 你还是常常喝得醉醺醺的；

example.en: Davy had just one more drink, and then he got a hag on.
example.zh: 戴维只多喝了一杯,后来就醉了。

list.explanation: 损失一大笔钱(尤指输于赌博)

example.en: She went to play the slot machines and dropped a bundle.
example.zh: 她去玩吃角子老虎机，结果输了一大笔钱。

example.en: He'll make a pitch for solar energy.
example.zh: 他将竭力为利用太阳能作宣传。

list.explanation: 没价值的，没用的，没意义的

example.en: This pen is not worth a damn.
example.zh: 这支钢笔没用了。

list.explanation: (黑人用语)无足轻重的人，不值得重视的人

example.en: He seems like a man with a paper ass to me; don't pay him any attention.
example.zh: 在我看来，他没有什么了不起的，你不必理会他。

example.en: He stopped everything to put a move on that Russian woman.
example.zh: 他把手头的事情都放下来，去向那个俄国女人调情。

list.explanation: 冒险、投机、贸然尝试(某事)，(在某事物上)孤注一掷(尤指在金钱方面)

example.en: He takes a flier iI polilics.
example.zh: 他贸然尝试从政。

example.en: KeIt was very reckless wheI he took a flyer oI that airliIe stock.
example.zh: 肯特在投机买卖航空业证券时是十分不顾及风险的。

example.en: I don't believe you, but what the hell, I'll take a flyer.
example.zh: 我不相信你的话,反正啊，我要豁出去了。

example.en: Have a captain at this!
example.zh: 瞧瞧这个!

example.en: They cast their arms to the ground. and did a bunk.
example.zh: 他们把武器扔在地上，逃走了。

example.en: He can read like a blue streak.
example.zh: 他能飞快地阅读。

example.en: The dog ran like a blue streak across the lawn.
example.zh: 狗从草坪上飞奔而过。

list.explanation: [戏剧用语]很小的角色(指台词极少甚至咳嗽一声就下台的角色〉

example.en: He played a cough and a spit in this show.
example.zh: 他在这出戏里演了个很不起眼的小角色。

example.en: The meetings were 5 dollars a throw.
example.zh: 那几次会议的参加费是毎人五块钱。

example.en: The kids are out on a bum at some school-sponsored dancing party.
example.zh: 小伙子们都出去参加学校主办的舞会，在狂欢作乐呐。

slang.tokens: have a bone to pick with

list.explanation: 同…有争端'对…有理由怀恨，抱怨(某人或某嚷物)

example.en: They had a bone to pick with neighbouring villages.
example.zh: 他们与邻村曾布过争端端。

example.en: The ambassador had a bone to pick with the student demonstrations.
example.zh: 大使就学生示威一事提出抗议。

example.en: His ego is big enough to choke a horse.
example.zh: 他极其自负。

list.explanation: (常用于祈使句)赶快，赶紧，加快速度

example.en: Shake a leg there! We'll never finish if you don't hurry up.
example.zh: 加快一点吧!要是你们不抓紧，我们就完不成了。

example.en: She told me to shake a leg,so I hurried the best I could.
example.zh: 她叫我加快速度，所以我就拼命地赶。

example.en: Let's shake a leg. The music's great.
example.zh: 咱们去跳舞吧。 这音乐很棒。

list.explanation: [贬义词](给提问者的)答复是否定的

example.en: A: " Has the new film received any praise?" B: "I could only say the answer is a lemon.
example.zh: 甲: "对这部新影片有人说好吗？" 乙: "我只能说，回答是否定的。"

list.explanation: 远不，断然不，根本不，一点儿也不

example.en: They couldn't solve the problem by a long shot.
example.zh: 他们根本不可能解决这个问题。

example.en: A: Have any cash? B: Not by a long shot.
example.zh: 甲:有现钱吗？乙:一点儿也没有。

example.en: You can bet London to a brick that it'll rain tomorrow.
example.zh: 你可以确信明天会下雨。

list.explanation: 用作形容词&ad 冷汗一身的(地)，胆战心惊的(地)

example.en: I was in a cold sweat while they counted the ballots.
example.zh: 在他们清点选票时，我是浑身冷汗。

example.en: He stood there in a cold sweat, waiting for something to happen.
example.zh: 他胆战心惊地站在那里，等待着怕出什么事。

list.explanation: 极为罕见地，难得有一次

example.en: I do this only once in a blue moon.
example.zh: 此事我只是极为偶然而为之。

example.en: Once in a blue moon I have a little wine with dinner.
example.zh: 我难得有一次在吃午饭时喝一点儿酒。

example.en: He said he wouldn' t take a back seat to anybody, but the President himself.
example.zh: 他说除了总统本人之外，他对谁都不买账。

example.en: He made a cleanup in the stock market.
example.zh: 他在股票市场赚了很大一笔钱。

slang.tokens: go over like a lead balloon

example.en: The joke went over like a lead balloon.
example.zh: 这笑话说得一点也不好笑。

example.en: My appeal to his better nature went over like a lead balloon.
example.zh: 我求他发发善心，结果是白费劲。

example.en: He fought a bottle all evening after he was told that his girlfriend would be married to another young man.
example.zh: 他得知他的女友将与另一青年人结婚的消息后，他猛喝了一晚上的酒。

example.en: I suddenly realized that I had been made a monkey out of by my opponents.
example.zh: 我突然意识到我被我的那些对手给耍了。

example.en: He didn't make a bean out of it.
example.zh: 他没有从中得到一个子儿。

list.explanation: 把某人或某物击倒，痛击某人

example.en: We knocked the villain for a loop.
example.zh: 我们把那恶棍狠狠揍了一顿。

list.explanation: 使某人十分惊奇、诧异、剌激、非常快活

example.en: The news of their marriage threw me for a loop.
example.zh: 他俩结婚的消息让我十分诧异。

example.en: I don't believe this climactic sequence doesn't knock you for a loop.
example.zh: 我不相信这一连串的高潮都剌激不了你。

example.en: Wouldn't that knock the boys for a loop?
example.zh: 难道那还不能让那些孩子快活吗？

list.explanation: 使某人或某事陷入困境，使受到严重干扰

example.en: The whole economy was thrown for a loop.
example.zh: 整个经济陷入了困境。

example.en: It must have knocked him for a loop,but he asked.
example.zh: 这件事一定使他吃了大亏，但这是他自找的。

example.en: We took a chance with weather when we were going on a walking tour.
example.zh: 我们在去徒步旅行时是怀着侥幸心理的，希望天气可能会好。

example.en: He would be crazy as a loon to set fire to the house.
example.zh: 要放火烧房子，他大概是发疯了。

example.en: I knew you' d throw a fit when I told you.
example.zh: 我就知道我一告诉你,你准会大发脾气。

list.explanation: 没价值的，没什么用处的，不起什么作用的

example.en: His word isn't worth a plugged nickel.
example.zh: 他的话一钱不值。

example.en: Mary isn't worth a plugged nickel at baseball.
example.zh: 玛丽在棒球方面是无用武之地的。

list.explanation: , 不过并没有出什么洋相。

example.en: Mary got a little tiffled, but nothing really gross.
example.zh: 玛丽媛点儿喝醉了

example.en: He's as mean as a louse with money matters.
example.zh: 他在金钱问题上吝啬到了极点。

example.en: Sam likes cop?ping a tube as it is full of excitement.
example.zh: 山姆喜爱冲浪，因为它充满刺激。

slang.tokens: stick out like a sore thumb

example.en: Do you think I would stick out like a sure thumb at the party if I wore this coat?
example.zh: 如果我穿这件上装, 你看我在宴会上会抢眼吗？

list.explanation: 潜伏着起破坏作用的东西或人，潜在的障碍，隐患，可疑的情况，不可告人的目的

example.en: Without removing the nigger in the fence，there is no prospect of success.
example.zh: 不消除隐患是不会有希望成功的。

slang.tokens: not able to hold a candle to

example.en: The cake from the bakery is not able to hold a candle to the one that Grandmonther made.
example.zh: 店里买来的蛋糕跟奶奶做的无法相比。

example.en: That salesman tried to sell me a gotdbrick, but I just walked out on him.
example.zh: 那个推销员竭力想哄骗我,但我只是走开没理他。

example.en: Mrs. Wilson was known to swear like a trooper on occasion.
example.zh: 威尔逊太太有时会破口大骂是出了 名的。

list.explanation: 焦虑不安的，紧张的，心烦的

example.en: She got home and found her husband in a state.
example.zh: 她回家发现丈夫焦虑不安。

example.en: l'm afraid my room's in a state.
example.zh: 恐怕我的房间里太乱。

example.en: His clothes were in a state.
example.zh: 他衣冠不整。

list.explanation: (多用于否定句)精尽微力，给一点帮助

example.en: Could anyone honestly say that we should have allowed Paris to be occupied and France defeated without lifting a finger?
example.zh: 坦白讲，有谁能说我们应该眼看着巴黎沦陷，法囯被击败而袖手旁观？

example.en: He never stirs a finger around house!
example.zh: 他在家里从不动手出一点力!

list.explanation: 失宠的，受怀疑的，名誉扫地的

example.en: He has been somewhat under a cloud since they found the corpse in his closet.
example.zh: 自从他们在他的壁橱里找到那具尸体之后，他就一直受到怀疑。

auth_sentence.content: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.

auth_sentence.content: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.
auth_sentence.res_content: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.

auth_sentence.content: In a country ravaged by civil war no less.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: In a country ravaged by civil war no less.

why must we learn to identify the risks we are going to take?

sentences.en: When I entered the room, I saw a man standing at the window.
sentences.cn: 我走进房间时, 看见一个男人站在窗前。

means.word_mean: (用于表示时间、速度、价格等意义的)每一

sentences.en: The boy was paid two dollars a day.
Apple costs five dollars a kilogram.

means.word_mean: (用在某些物质名词和抽象名词前)一阵、一场、一种

sentences.en: A gentle wind disturbed the surface of the water.
He was caught in a heavy rain.
